intro: Afrocalathea, commonly known as the African calathea, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical regions of Africa. These plants are characterized by their striking, often variegated foliage, which features intricate patterns of green, silver, and white. Afrocalathea species are typically herbaceous perennials, with upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. They thrive in humid, shady environments and require well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to their ornamental value, they are popular in horticulture for indoor and outdoor gardens.
